intro: Androsace altaica, commonly known as the Altaian rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are usually basal, ovate to elliptical, and covered with a fine layer of white hair. Androsace altaica thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
